examples: The army is here, your liberty is assured.

definitions.definition: The condition of being free from imprisonment , slavery or forced labour .
examples: The prisoners gained their liberty from an underground tunnel.

definitions.definition: The condition of being free to act , believe or express oneself as one chooses .
examples: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.

definitions.definition: A short period when a sailor is allowed ashore .
examples: We're going on a three-day liberty as soon as we dock.

definitions.definition: A local division of government administration in medieval England .
An empty space next to a group of stones of the same color.

secondary_definitions: The condition of being free from imprisonment , slavery or forced labour .
The condition of being free to act , believe or express oneself as one chooses .
A short period when a sailor is allowed ashore .
( often plural ) A breach of social convention .
( historical ) A local division of government administration in medieval England .
( go ) An empty space next to a group of stones of the same color.
